Over the next 14 days, we'll be sharing reminders and resources to help you and your children prepare for the first day of school.

Today's resource: a helpful video from the World Health Organization (WHO) - "How to wear a fabric mask safely."

Over the next two weeks, we encourage you to:

‚úÖ Have your child/children practice putting a face covering on and taking it off. Make sure the face covering fits properly and is comfortable.

‚úÖ Have your child/children wear the face covering for 30-45 minutes at a time, a few times per day.

‚úÖ Make a "Do you have your mask?" reminder for the front door, the car, the coat rack, or one of the last places you or your kids stop before leaving for school.

‚úÖ Consider sending a small disposable or reusable plastic bag where your child/children can keep their mask during mask breaks and lunch so that it stays clean throughout the day.

Watch this video for more helpful tips: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9Tv2BVN_WTk

The Keystone Oaks Board of School Directors will hold a Special Voting Meeting at 7 p.m. on Tuesday, May 12, 2020; the purpose of the meeting is to vote on the 2020-2021 Proposed Final Budget.

The meeting will be held as a Zoom meeting with board members, the district solicitor, the superintendent and the board secretary. Members of the public who wish to submit public comment should do so by emailing the superintendent (stropkaj@kosd.org) by 6 p.m. on Tuesday, May 12. Comments will be read during the meeting.

The superintendent and the board secretary will participate from the Board Room, which is located in the High School. The meeting will be open to the public, but space is limited in order to comply with social distancing guidelines.

The agenda for the Special Voting Meeting will be posted on the District's website by 3 p.m. on Monday, May 11.

URGENT: Due to concerns regarding the Novel Coronavirus (COVID-19), the Keystone Oaks School District will be CLOSED from Monday, March 16 through Friday, March 27, 2020. This closure applies to all activities, events, sporting events, and facility reservations scheduled during this time period.
